page.title: 01General Review
page.content: The main feature in this block is {Castlemorton Common,}an area of rough, unfenced grassland stretching from the {Malvern Hills}in the West to the villages of{Welland}and {Castlemorton}in the East. The Hills rise to 342 metres (Herefordshire Beacon) in the North and to 286 metres (Midsummer Hill) in the South. From here there is a wonderful view over the Severn Valley towards the Cotswolds. The summit of Midsummer Hill is owned by the National Trust. The remainder of the Hills and Commons comes under the jurisdiction of the Malvern Hills Conservators. The rest of the area is predominantly rich, enclosed pasture land, with farmers concentrating on cattle (both for milk and beef) and sheep.
